item.title: S. 1071, A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior, through the Bureau of Reclamation, to conduct a feasibility study on a water conservation project within the Arch Hurley Conservancy District in the state of New Mexico, and for other
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on April 28, 2004

item.title: S. 1071, A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior, through the Bureau of Reclamation, to conduct a feasibility study on a water conservation project within the Arch Hurley Conservancy District in the state of New Mexico, and for other
item.description: Cost estimate for the bill as ordered reported by the Senate Committee on Energy and Natural Resources on April 28, 2004

item.name: Federal aid to water resources development

summary.text: Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior, through the Bureau of Reclamation, to study and report to Congress on the feasibility of implementing a water conservation project that will minimize water losses from the irrigation conveyance works of the Arch Hurley Conservancy District, and to consider: (1) options for utilizing any saved water, including conveyance to the Pecos River basin; (2) the impacts that the project could have on the local water supply in and around the District and any appropriate mitigation that may be necessary; and (3) cost-sharing options for implementation based on the use and possible allocation of any conserved water.

Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior, through the Bureau of Reclamation, to study and report to Congress on the feasibility of implementing a water conservation project that will minimize water losses from the irrigation conveyance works of the Arch Hurley Conservancy District and to consider: (1) options for utilizing any saved water, including conveyance to the Pecos River basin; (2) the impacts the project could have on the local water supply and any appropriate mitigation that may be necessary; and (3) cost-sharing options for implementation based on the use and possible allocation of any conserved water.

Authorizes appropriations. Limits the Federal share of the costs of the study to 50 percent, but authorizes the Secretary to: (1) waive or limit the required non-Federal cost share based upon financial hardship; and (2) accept as part of the non-Federal share the contribution of in-kind services.

bill.title: A bill to authorize the Secretary of the Interior, through the Bureau of Reclamation, to conduct a feasibility study on a water conservation project within the Arch Hurley Conservancy District in the State of New Mexico, and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
